skill.name: youtube-transcript
skill.description: Download and process YouTube video transcripts using yt-dlp. Use this when extracting subtitles, creating summaries from videos, or processing video content.
skill.summary: Download and process YouTube video transcripts using yt-dlp. Use this when extracting subtitles, cre...
skill.author: Doyajin174

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and workflow guidance. No executable code, no network operations, no file access beyond Claude tool permissions. The skill consists of 138 lines of markdown documentation describing yt-dlp usage patterns.

content.value_statement: Manually created captions often have better quality than auto-generated ones. This skill provides a systematic approach to download YouTube subtitles using yt-dlp with fallback options for videos without captions.
actual_capabilities: Download YouTube video transcripts in multiple languages
Prioritize manually created subtitles over auto-generated ones
Convert VTT subtitle files to plain text
Handle videos without captions using Whisper fallback
limitations: Requires yt-dlp to be installed on the system
Cannot extract transcripts from private or deleted videos
Whisper fallback requires user confirmation due to processing time

use_cases.title: Research and reference
use_cases.description: Extract transcripts from educational videos for quotes and references

use_cases.title: Video summarization
use_cases.description: Download captions to create summaries and chapter outlines from long videos

use_cases.title: Multilingual content access
use_cases.description: Get transcripts in native and target languages for study materials

prompt_templates.title: Basic transcript
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract the transcript from this YouTube video: [VIDEO_URL]

prompt_templates.title: Multi-language
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract both English and Korean subtitles from this video: [VIDEO_URL]

prompt_templates.title: Clean output
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the transcript and convert it to clean text without timestamps: [VIDEO_URL]

prompt_templates.title: Full processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the transcript, remove duplicates, create a summary with key topics and timestamps: [VIDEO_URL]

output_examples.input: Extract the transcript from this YouTube lecture video about Python programming
output: â€¢ Video: Introduction to Python Functions
â€¢ Summary: This lecture covers defining functions, parameters, return values, and best practices
â€¢ Key topics: function syntax, default arguments, *args/**kwargs, docstrings

best_practices: Prefer manual captions over auto-generated for better accuracy
Verify video availability before attempting download
Request user confirmation before using Whisper fallback for long videos
anti_patterns: Attempting to download from private or unavailable videos
Using auto-generated captions when manual ones are available
Processing large videos without checking file size first

faq.question: What languages are supported?
faq.answer: YouTube supports many languages. Use --list-subs to see available options for each video.

faq.question: What if a video has no captions?
faq.answer: Try Whisper fallback. This downloads the audio and uses OpenAI Whisper for transcription.

faq.question: Can I use this with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. Install yt-dlp first, then Claude can execute the transcript extraction workflow.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only accesses YouTube public data. No personal information is collected or stored.

faq.question: Why do auto-captions have duplicates?
faq.answer: Progressive captions on YouTube repeat content. The skill includes deduplication logic for cleaner output.

faq.question: How is this different from other transcript tools?
faq.answer: This skill prioritizes manually created captions for accuracy and provides systematic fallback options.
